p: Human Aichi virus (AiV) strain A846/88, the prototype strain of the genus Kobuvirus, was first discovered in 1989 as the cause of oyster-associated nonbacterial gastroenteritis in humans in Aichi Prefecture, Japan [ 68]. Since then, several investigations have revealed that AiVs are involved in 0.9â€“4.1% of sporadic cases of pediatric gastroenteritis [ 69, 70, 71, 72].
